new.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: recently made, built, invented, written, designed etc
new.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The hardest part of this job is understanding the new technology.
new.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Do you like my new dress?
They’ve just moved into their new home.
new.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: a young man with new ideas
a new generation of women writers
a medical breakthrough that offers new hope to cancer patients
new.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: not used or owned by anyone before
new.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: New and second-hand books for sale.
I got a used video camera for £300 – it would have cost £1,000 if I’d bought it new.
Jake arrived in his brand new (=completely new) car.
a spanking new (=completely new) conference centre
new.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Learning a new language is always a challenge.
Living in the city was a new experience for Philip.
‘The office is going to be closed for six weeks this summer.’ ‘Really? That’s a new one on me.’
that’s a new one on me
This idea was new to him.
new.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: having recently arrived in a place, joined an organization, or started a new job
new.translation[0].definitions[5].note.t: the new boy/girl British English (=the newest person in a job, organization etc – used humorously)
new.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: It’s not always easy being the new kid on the block.
Don’t worry if you make mistakes. You’re still new to the job.
new.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: recently replaced or different from the previous one
new.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: Have you met Keith’s new girlfriend?
I’ll let you have my new phone number.
new.translation[0].definitions[7].exampl: the discovery of a new planet
important new evidence that may prove her innocence
new.translation[0].definitions[9].defini: new potatoes, carrots etc are grown early in the season and eaten when young
We’ve got a lovely new car
We’ve got a new lovely car
He wore his new blue shirt
He wore his blue new shirt
new.translation[0].note_box[1].sections[: a new sports centre
a new edition of the book
an entirely new theory of time and space
brand new
completely new
a brand new car
The house looks brand new.
recent
made, produced etc a short time ago
recent research into brain chemistry
the latest
the most recent
Have you seen his latest film?
the latest fashions from Paris
different from earlier things of the same kind because of using new methods, equipment, or designs
modern technology
modern farming methods
a modern kitchen
original
new and completely different from what other people have done or thought of before, especially in a way that seems interesting
The play is highly original.
His style is completely original.
fresh ideas, evidence, or ways of doing things are new and different, and are used instead of previous ones
We need a fresh approach to the problem.
They want young people with fresh ideas.
Police think they may have found some fresh evidence that links him to the murder.
novel
new and different in a surprising and unusual way – used especially about a suggestion, experience, or way of doing something
The club have come up with a novel way of raising cash.
The King was passionately in love, which was a novel experience for him.
innovative
completely new and showing a lot of imagination – used especially about a design or way of doing something
an attractive website with an innovative design
They came up with an innovative approach to the problem.
revolutionary
completely new in a way that has a very big effect – used especially about an idea, method, or invention
a revolutionary treatment for breast cancer
His theories were considered to be revolutionary at the time.
newfangled
used about something that is new and modern but which you disapprove of
My grandfather hated all this newfangled technology.
